33Across.description: “Monetize mobile web traffic with mobile in-feed video” – Source
33Across.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.2% of surveyed sites (13 instances observed).
33Across.notes:
• “Get the full picture of what content is performing and what’s shared privately.” – Source [Surely, not being ‘shared privately’, then, is it? – Ed.]
  • “33Across provides Products that enable Clients to gain insights into how their content is being consumed and shared by end-users. Using browser cookie technology, end-user data is collected across multiple websites to provide these insights and consists of behavioral information regarding the web pages they visit and/or the actions they take on websites, such as copying or sharing content, clicking on hyperlinks or advertising on the page, or signing up for products or services offered by our Clients.” – Source
  • “Some of our Products insert advertising from our partners on our Client websites. We record information that an ad was requested or shown, and any user interactions with the ad or the page where the ad appears.” – Source
  • “When we refer to Non-PII in this policy, we mean information that does not use a commonly recognized identifier such as name, address, email, or telephone number to identify a particular person.” – Source [Hmm… how about uncommon ones…? – Ed.]
  • “Keep in mind that in certain contexts and jurisdictions, some information that we in this policy regard as Non-PII, such as IP addresses, may be regarded as “personal data” under data protection legislation in the European Union and elsewhere.” – Source [Look into my eyes, not around the eyes… – Ed.]
  • “Some of our business partners (for example, Google Analytics) or Clients may set or use their own cookies on our Website or through the Products we provide. However, we have no access to or control over these cookies.” – Source [Umm, yes you do… you can choose not to use those services. Oh, but wait, you’re in the same business… our bad. –Ed.]
  • – Privacy policy

ADITION.description: “ADITION technologies AG designs and develops ad-serving solutions.” – Source
ADITION.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.5% of surveyed sites (35 instances observed).

AdKernel.description: “adKernel is a white-label advertising serving platform” – Source
AdKernel.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.3% of surveyed sites (21 instances observed).
AdKernel.notes: • “We are leaders in delivering high-quality digital traffic using human presence detection features, filters, white and black lists, and rigorous monitoring of quality metrics and user behavior.” – Source

AdRoll.description: “AdRoll provides targeted advertising services for our advertiser clients” – Source
AdRoll.prevalence: High: found on 2.5% of surveyed sites (176 instances observed).
AdRoll.notes:
• “We may collect the following categories of information for the purposes explained below: Advertiser website activity, Device and browser information, Ad data, Data from Advertising Partners, Email and Postal Addresses from Advertisers” – Source
  • “The AdRoll platform uses cookies, tracking pixels and related technologies to provide our services for Advertisers.” – Source

Adlucent.description: “Paid Search, Product Ads, Display & Remarketing, CSE & Feeds, Mobile, Omnichannel” – Source
Adlucent.notes:
• “We employ a software technology called clear gifs (a.k.a. Web Beacons/Web Bugs)” – Source
  • “In the event Adlucent LLC goes through a business transition, such as a merger, acquisition by another company, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, your personally identifiable information will likely be among the assets transferred.” – Source

AvantLink.description: “AvantLink is an online affiliate referral platform” – Source
AvantLink.notes: • AvantLink only has privacy policies for first party merchants in United States, Canada, and Australia. – AvantLink Privacy Policies.

BlueCava.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.2% of surveyed sites (13 instances observed).

BlueKai.description: “BlueKai is a cloud-based big data platform that enables companies to personalize online, offline, and mobile marketing campaigns.” – Source
BlueKai.prevalence: High: found on 3.5% of surveyed sites (247 instances observed).
BlueKai.notes:
• “On February 24, 2014 Oracle announced that it signed an agreement to acquire BlueKai to extend the world's largest Marketing Cloud with the leading Data Management Platform to personalize marketing programs and customer experience.” – Source
  • “When using Oracle Marketing Cloud and Oracle Data Cloud services for interest-based advertising, our customers, data providers and partners share, collect, store and process information about individuals as well as attributes and behaviors of users of mobile devices and computers ("Marketing Information"). This may include information that does not identify you as well as information that does.” – Source
  • “The Oracle Marketing Cloud and Oracle Data Cloud services and our customers, data providers and partners use a variety of technologies to collect Marketing Information, including ‘pixel tags’…” – Source

CONTEXTWEB.description: “PulsePoint works with online advertising companies to provide you with advertising that is as relevant and useful as possible. Some of the online ads you are served may be based on the content of the Web page you are visiting; some others may be based on registration information you provide; and other ads may be customized based on predictions about your interests generated from your visits to other Web sites.” – Source
CONTEXTWEB.prevalence: High: found on 2.5% of surveyed sites (174 instances observed).
CONTEXTWEB.notes:
• Datran Media and ContextWeb merged to form PulsePoint.
  • – PulsePoint’s Privacy Policy.
  • “[PulsePoint’s] Ad Exchange also engages in online behavioral advertising… These processes are carried out using cookies and pixels.” – Source.

Casale Media.description: “Casale Media is a tech company providing online display and advertising services.” – Source
Casale Media.prevalence: High: found on 5.0% of surveyed sites (350 instances observed).
Casale Media.notes:
• “Since 2003, it has established its presence in digital advertising through its ad network, MediaNet, which is powered by Optimax, its real-time ad serving and optimization platform.” – Source
  • “Casale Media may obtain data from third party companies for the purpose of informing ad selection.” – Source
  • Casale Media was rebranded as Index Exchange. – Source
  • – Index Exchange’s privacy policy

Chango.prevalence: High: found on 1.6% of surveyed sites (112 instances observed).
Chango.notes: • Chango was acquired by Rubicon Project in 2015… “The acquisition enables Rubicon Project to expand its premium advertising marketplace to include intent marketing capabilities, providing access to data-driven targeting and retargeting budgets.” – Source

ChoiceStream.description: “ChoiceStream is the only media company that validates audience segments by asking people what they like, what they want, what they think. We ask questions at Pollshare.com, a consumer website owned and operated by ChoiceStream, and use the insights we gather to filter the data that comes in with every ad call.” – Source
ChoiceStream.notes:
• “We provide the highest quality audiences because we use 1st party, self-declared data” – Source
  • “Real people are our source of truth. Through our owned and operated site, pollshare.com, we ask consumers questions that uncover motivation, preference, intent and more.” – Source
  • “Our technology was built to evolve, constantly testing thousands of algorithms. And we feed it higher quality audience data.” – Source

Criteo.description: “Criteo is a ‘personalized retargeting company’ that works with Internet retailers to serve personalized online display advertisements to consumers that have previously visited the advertiser’s website.” – Source
Criteo.prevalence: Pandemic: found on 14.5% of surveyed sites (1022 instances observed).
Criteo.notes:
• “Criteo specializes in creating personalized advertisements. We work with online partners to build advertisements for users who visit their website or mobile applications and with publishers to display personalized advertisements.” – Source
  • “The browser cookies track the products viewed by the visitor and pages visited of the partner for whom Criteo is delivering ads. Pixel tags are used by Criteo to transfer browsing data from visitors of our partner's websites to Criteo's servers.” – Source

Ensighten.description: “Ensighten is a global omni-channel data and tag management technology vendor headquartered in San Jose, California.” – Source
Ensighten.prevalence: High: found on 1.5% of surveyed sites (102 instances observed).
Ensighten.notes: • May render your site invisible if you use it.

ExoClick.description: “ExoClick is a Barcelona-based online advertising company, which provides online advertising services to both advertisers and publishers all over the world via web, mobile, tablet and smart TV.” – Source
ExoClick.prevalence: High: found on 1.3% of surveyed sites (93 instances observed).

Flashtalking.description: “Targeted Ads: Right time, right place, right person.” – Source
Flashtalking.prevalence: High: found on 1.3% of surveyed sites (88 instances observed).
Flashtalking.notes:
• “Flashtalking’s advanced targeting and dynamic ad capabilities are fully integrated with industry standard third party data sources providing you with a greater opportunity to target different messages to targeted prospect audiences.” – Source
  • “For example you can combine Audience Science, Experian on-site and off-site audience data, even YouTube audience segmentation, with Flashtalking dynamic ads to deliver effective contextual advertising” – Source

Flite.description: “[F]ull-screen video ad solution to increase demand and extend scale” – Source
Flite.notes: • Irony: Encountered as a full-page, autoplaying video doorslam on Motherboard’s review of Better – Ed.

GumGum.description: “GumGum is a tracking, reporting and monetization technology for licensing content for Internet use.” – Source
GumGum.prevalence: Moderate: found on 1.0% of surveyed sites (69 instances observed).

Jivox.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.4% of surveyed sites (28 instances observed).
Jivox.notes:
• Privacy Policy
  • Jivox’s customers include “Martha Stewart, Videology, Microsoft Advertising, IXM Demand Media, YuMe, Undertone, The Wall Street Journal, Havas, Mojiva, Four Digital, UM, Wieden + Kennedy, 33 Across, A+E Networks, Reader’s Digest, Esquire, RJPalmer, Meredith, Gannett, CoxMedia Group, CollegeHumor, Daily News, Charter, MobileFuse, Fox Sports, Federated Media Publishing, Martini Media Network, Adap.tv, Razorfish, [and] Chicago Sun-Times” – Source

Jumptap.description: “Millennial Media is an advertising company that places display ads on mobile devices.” – Source
Jumptap.notes:
• “On September 03, 2015, AOL agreed to buy Millennial Media for US$ 238 million” – Source
  • “Millennial Media has acquired several companies, including TapMetrics in 2010, Condaptive in 2011, Jumptap in 2013, and Nexage in 2014.” – Source

MdotM.notes:
• Can someone please tell us why in sweet Cthulthu’s name does their privacy policy feature a video of (what we can only assume are) their employees on vacation? – Ed.
  • “When you use a Network Application, the Application may access and collect certain information from you. This may include, but is not limited to, your Network Application ID for which that Network Application resides within, profile data you disclose to the Network Application such as gender, age, photo, city location, mobile number, other Network App IDs you communicate with as part of your interaction with the Network Application, advertisements that were delivered to you and that you clicked on, and other click-stream data. This data may be shared with CrossChannel and we will use such data to deliver more targeted content to you while using Network Applications.” Source

NetSeer.description: “Our ConceptGraph is the force behind all we do. This patented intent engine unearths natural associations that form between words and ideas in the human mind. By integrating a cross-section of data sources, the ConceptGraph surfaces an accurate, high-definition picture of audience intent … NetSeer’s ConceptGraph has its Big Data roots in genetics and statistical physics.” – Source
NetSeer.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.4% of surveyed sites (26 instances observed).
NetSeer.notes:
• Concepts: “Our fundamental targeting unit is the Concept. Simply put, Concepts are atoms of intent. What’s so interesting about Concepts is how they transcend words and syntax to capture the deeper, often implicit associations between ideas. These form naturally, just as they do in the human brain.” – Source

  • Concept Targeting: “Our proprietary targeting methodology functions as a predictive, high-performance decoder of consumer mindset. In other words, we read between the lines to zero-in on consumer intent.” – Source

  • The ConceptGraph “is a ‘living’ thing. To date we’ve captured 52 million unique Concepts and 2.3 billion associations between those Concepts. How did we do this? By connecting the “data dots” between a variety of online signals, analyzing and encoding the content of trillions of webpages, and integrating proprietary insights from our extensive NetSeer publisher network.” – Source

  • – Privacy policy

Outbrain.description: “Outbrain pays publishers to put its links on their sites.” – Source
Outbrain.prevalence: High: found on 2.0% of surveyed sites (142 instances observed).
Outbrain.notes:
• “Outbrain has acquired three companies—related content recommendation platform, Surphace (February 2011), content curation platform, Scribit (December 2012), and predictive analytics company, Visual Revenue (March 2013).” – Source
  • “Outbrain has often been compared with competitor Taboola.” – Source

Peer39.description: “Sizmek Technologies, Inc. provides digital advertising management solutions.” – Source

Polar Mobile.description: “Solutions built to help publishers monetize and thrive.” – Source
Polar Mobile.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.4% of surveyed sites (28 instances observed).
Polar Mobile.notes: • We could not find a privacy policy on Polar’s web site. We’ve asked them on Twitter to provide a link and we’ll update this page when they do.

PubMatic.description: “PubMatic is” a “marketing automation software company for publishers.” Using “real-time analytics, yield management, and workflow automation.” – Source
PubMatic.prevalence: Epidemic: found on 5.0% of surveyed sites (353 instances observed).
PubMatic.notes: • “We and our third party service providers may collect Other Information in a variety of ways, including through:… pixel tags” (also known as web bugs.) – Source

RevContent.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.5% of surveyed sites (37 instances observed).

RuTarget.description: “[A]d tech company developing on-demand solutions which help business to analyse, predict and target digital communications.” – Source
RuTarget.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.2% of surveyed sites (17 instances observed).
RuTarget.notes:
• RuTarget: Harnessing Russian Data
  • The site now redirects to segmento.ru and the company has informed us that they now ‘use only one brand for all communication’ (– Source)
  • No privacy policy.
  • Their Twitter account

Selectable Media.description: “Selectable Media allows individuals to unlock digital content in exchange for interacting with brand advertisements.” – Source
Selectable Media.notes: • “Our Clients use our services to enhance their websites, services, advertising, and related offerings. These sites may place their own cookies on your computer, collect data, or solicit personal information. For more information about their information practices, please refer to their privacy policies.” Privacy Policy

Simpli.fi.description: “Simplifi Holdings, Inc. is a company that provides online advertising services.” – Source
Simpli.fi.prevalence: High: found on 1.5% of surveyed sites (108 instances observed).
Simpli.fi.notes:
• “Simpli.fi is an advertising technology company that simplifies digital advertising through the use of unstructured data.” – Source
  • “We employ a software technology called clear gifs (a.k.a. Web Beacons/Web Bugs)” – Source

SiteScout.description: “SiteScout is the leading self-serve ad platform for marketing professionals and agencies.” – – Source
SiteScout.prevalence: High: found on 1.8% of surveyed sites (128 instances observed).
SiteScout.notes:
• “63,819 Users; 68,357 Websites; 73 Exchanges; 145,678 Campaigns; 31B Daily ad views;” – Source
  • – SiteScout’s Privacy Policy
  • “We share aggregate information about our users for marketing purposes. We also share aggregate information with third party providers…” – Source
  • “Does SiteScout use web beacons (aka clear GIFs or web bugs)? Yes.” – Source

Spongecell.description: “Spongecell’s programmatic creative combines best-in-class data processing and powerful creative tools to make it easy to build beautiful, personalized ads for display, mobile, and video.” – Source
Spongecell.notes:
• “By visiting the Site, using the Service, and/or interacting with any Ad Unit, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy and the accompanying Terms of Use.” – Source
  • “We may also allow third-party companies that are presenting advertisements on the Site to set and access their own cookies. Such third-party cookies are not governed by this Privacy Policy, but by the privacy policies of such third party.” – Source
  • “The Site and the Service are operated in the United States. If you are located outside of the United States, please be aware that any information you provide to us will be transferred to the United States. By using the Service and/or providing us with any information, you consent to this transfer.” – Source
  • “The opt–out does not mean that you will no longer see Spongecell advertisements. It means only that Ad Units delivered by Spongecell will not be personalized to you…” – Source [They apparently wanted to end it “losers” but Legal vetoed. Killjoys. – Ed.]

SpotXchange.description: “SpotX is a hosted advertising management platform that provides targeted advertisement insertion and scheduling, campaign management and reporting on a real-time basis primarily used in the monetization of online video content.” – Source
SpotXchange.prevalence: High: found on 1.3% of surveyed sites (94 instances observed).
SpotXchange.notes:
• “SpotX’s platform for streaming video ads enables advertisers to target their campaigns against particular contextual, geographic, interest or demographic criteria associated with the website or browser” – Source
  • “SpotX may also make requests to multiple third-party data vendors for additional anonymous user audience information that is used for targeting, analytic and reporting purposes … the third-party data vendors may provide SpotX with [data] that can be merged with existing [data].”

Swoop.description: “Swoop provides services to websites and consumers that help personalize and customize consumers’ user experience and provide more relevant content and offers for consumers as they browse our partners’ websites and the web.” – Source
Swoop.notes:
• – Swoop’s Privacy Policy
  • “Paying close attention to the privacy policies of the websites visited remains one of the best ways to make informed choices about privacy.” – Source [Because we really all have time to read the privacy policies for every third party script on every site we visit… - Ed.]
  • “[W]e collect information about consumers’ use of our partners’ websites and the interaction with our Shopping Services implementations.” – Source

Taboola.description: “Taboola is a content marketing ‘clickbait’ platform that provides a web widget to content creators on their website to display advertisements for articles, videos, and slideshows, both from within the site and from other publishers.” – Source
Taboola.prevalence: High: found on 3.9% of surveyed sites (276 instances observed).
Taboola.notes:
• Taboola: The internet firm at the forefront of 'click-bait' (BBC News)
  • “We collect User Information automatically through a User’s use of or interaction with our Services. We automatically collect Information through a User’s use of our Services through cookies and other technologies…” – Source
  • “We may disclose User Information to any current or future affiliates, parent companies, or subsidiaries.” – Source
  • “We may disclose User Information to other unaffiliated third parties, such as our Customers.” – Source
  • “In order to target advertisements to you for products and services in which you might be interested, we may use cookies, JavaScript, web beacons (including clear GIFs), HTML5 local storage and other technologies.” – Source

Tapad.description: “Tapad Inc. is a venture-funded startup company that develops and markets software and services for cross-device advertising and content delivery. It uses algorithms to analyze internet and device data and predict whether two or more devices are owned by the same person.” – Source
Tapad.prevalence: High: found on 2.7% of surveyed sites (190 instances observed).
Tapad.notes:
• “In order to establish connections between devices, to provide insights and reporting to partners, and to provide more relevant ads to users, we collect and store select information about devices directly from the device. We may also receive additional information about the device or the individual from partners with an existing relationship with the individual or from other third parties. For example, we may receive inferred demographic data, user-declared demographic data, or obfuscated user login data.” – Source
  • “A pixel is a piece of code which is used by a website or third party to assign online activities to a computer or browser. The use of a pixel allows websites and us to record, for example, that a user has visited a particular web page or clicked on a particular ad.” – Source

TubeMogul.description: “TubeMogul is a publicly traded company whose main product is an enterprise software platform for digital video advertising.” – Source
TubeMogul.prevalence: High: found on 2.1% of surveyed sites (149 instances observed).
TubeMogul.notes:
• “TubeMogul provides a platform that is designed to help advertisers place advertisements into content that you view while online, using mobile applications (apps), using other devices such as set-top boxes or connected TVs, or simply watching television. Our advertising platform integrates real-time media buying, ad serving, targeting, optimization and measurement” – Source
  • “Our advertising platform also uses web beacons to help use utilize data from our third party business partners” – Source

Undertone.description: “Undertone is a digital advertising company that may deliver advertisements to the websites you visit.” – Source
Undertone.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.2% of surveyed sites (12 instances observed).
Undertone.notes:
• “As part of our ad delivery and reporting, we log page views and collect information for the purpose of delivering ads or providing advertising-related services, including providing a specific advertisement based on a particular type of browser or time of day; statistical reporting in connection with the activity on a website; and tracking the number of ads served on a particular day to a particular website. To do so, we collect information about the type of browser and operating system of website visitors, as well as the domain name, day and time of visit, and page(s) visited. We do so across multiple web domains owned or operated by different entities (each, a “Site”).” – Source
  • “[W]e collect data across multiple web domains owned or operated by different entities to categorize likely consumer interest segments for use in advertising online (‘Interest-Based Advertising’ or ‘IBA’). For example, we can analyze data to determine that a visitor of a particular site at 6:30PM is more likely to be interested in pizza, or antique cars, or a classic movie” – Source
  • “We collect the information described above by using log files, web beacons and cookies. We often engage or cooperate with service and technology companies to collect this information.” – Source

Visible Measures.description: “Visible Measures Corporation provides content advertising technology.” – Source
Visible Measures.notes:
• “Our Data Management Platform stores large scale user-level data used to produce custom audience segments for targeting content advertising.” – Source.
  • – Visible Measures’ Privacy Policy
  • “Visible Measures collects information…[on] how many people watch video clips and what player features (recommend, e-mail, pause, etc.) viewers take advantage of.” – Source
  • “Some of our older APIs still use ‘flash cookies’…” – Source

VisualDNA.description: lockquote style="text-align:justify">“Imagini is a London-based software firm founded in 2006. It uses images instead of questions to do marketing tasks such as psychographic marketing research and social networking. Using Imagini's ‘VisualDNA’ technology, Web visitors respond to queries such as ‘My biggest vice is...’ or ‘My idea of love is...’ by clicking on images, and software algorithms analyse the choices made to learn more about that particular person's preferences, likes and attitudes; then, a profile is constructed of the person which the firm describes as that person's Visual DNA.” – Source</blockquote>
VisualDNA.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.4% of surveyed sites (28 instances observed).

Wishabi.description: “Capture shoppers as they plan their weekly shopping trip with the Flipp app and Flipp Network - the world’s largest shopper marketing platform.” – Source
Wishabi.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.8% of surveyed sites (58 instances observed).

Yahoo!.description: “Yahoo is globally known for its Web portal, search engine Yahoo! Search, and related services, including Yahoo! Directory, Yahoo! Mail, Yahoo! News, Yahoo! Finance, Yahoo! Groups, Yahoo! Answers, advertising, online mapping, video sharing, fantasy sports and its social media website.” – Source
Yahoo!.prevalence: Epidemic: found on 6.7% of surveyed sites (472 instances observed).
Yahoo!.notes:
• Yahoo provides ads and analytics on other sites. – Source
  • “Yahoo uses web beacons to access Yahoo cookies inside and outside our network of web sites and in connection with Yahoo products and services.” – Source

Yieldify.description: “Introducing Predict and Convert: combine your website data and meta-analysis of thousands of similar campaigns to maximise your ROI.” – yieldify.com

Yieldmo.description: “Yieldmo has code on mobile web pages as well as Android/iOS apps. Our exclusive ad placements include in-content, footer, and a unique placement type we call the Wrapper, which includes a header and footer placement along with in-content units. ” – Source
Yieldmo.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.6% of surveyed sites (43 instances observed).

YuMe.notes:
• “Our unique technology approach unifies fragmentation—namely content, screen, technology, and data fragmentation.” – Source
  • “We harness the power of software and data by permitting publishers to embed our proprietary software in their properties; we then receive tons of data from the embedded software, analyze the data with machine learning algorithms and finally, by doing this, we believe YuMe delivers TV-scale audiences who are actually paying attention to the advertisers video ad.” – Source

Zemanta.description: “Zemanta is a global provider of advertising technology to advertisers and agencies.” – – Source
Zemanta.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.2% of surveyed sites (11 instances observed).
Zemanta.notes:
• Zemanta’s Privacy Policy.
  • “[W]e collect certain information about you and your device… may be considered ‘personal data’ in some jurisdictions in the European Union and elsewhere.” – Source
  • “We may also collect information about our partners’ interactions with you—for example, by placing pixels on an advertiser’s webpage…” – Source

cXense.description: “1:1 recommendation engine. We deliver real-time, cross-device personalization to amplify user experiences, drive conversion rates, and increase your digital revenue.” – Source
cXense.prevalence: High: found on 1.0% of surveyed sites (71 instances observed).

comScore.description: “comScore is an American global media measurement and analytics company” – Source

media.net.description: “Media.net is a contextual ad network which reaches more than 100 Million US desktop users.” – Source
media.net.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.7% of surveyed sites (50 instances observed).
media.net.notes:
• Media.net Acquired by Chinese Consortium for $900 Million USD
  • Privacy policy

xplosion interactive.description: “Data driven performance for brands” – Source
xplosion interactive.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.4% of surveyed sites (29 instances observed).

Adap.tv.description: A “platform capable of injecting branded rich media such as video, photos and apps directly into various online advertising and social media.” – Source
Adap.tv.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.8% of surveyed sites (56 instances observed).

Brightcove.description: “Brightcove is a Boston, Massachusetts–based software company that produces an online video platform.” – Source
Brightcove.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.7% of surveyed sites (51 instances observed).

Disqus.description: “Disqus, Inc. is a blog comment hosting service for web sites and online communities that uses a networked platform.” – Source
Disqus.prevalence: High: found on 1.8% of surveyed sites (128 instances observed).
Disqus.notes:
• “Advertising is the primary way Disqus makes money. We are paid by advertisers to serve content. We share that resulting revenue with the publishers using this feature of our Service.” – Source
  • “We may receive Personally Identifiable Information about you from third parties, including, for example, information about your transactions, purchase history, or relationships with various product and service providers, and your use of certain applications. For example, if you access our website or Service through a third-party connection or log-in, for example, through Facebook Connect, by “following,” “liking,” linking your account to the Disqus service, etc., that third party may pass certain information about your use of its service to Disqus.” – Source
  • “Clear Gifs/Web Beacons Information: When you use the Service, we may employ clear gifs (also known as web beacons)” – Source

Facebook.description: “Facebook is a corporation and an online social networking service.” – Source
Facebook.prevalence: Pandemic: found on 29.9% of surveyed sites (2107 instances observed).
Facebook.notes:
• “We collect information when you visit or use third-party websites and apps that use our Services (like when they offer our Like button or Facebook Log In or use our measurement and advertising services). This includes information about the websites and apps you visit, your use of our Services on those websites and apps, as well as information the developer or publisher of the app or website provides to you or us.” – Source
  • “We receive information about you and your activities on and off Facebook from third-party partners, such as information from a partner when we jointly offer services or from an advertiser about your experiences or interactions with them.” – Source
  • “When you use third-party apps, websites or other services that use, or are integrated with, our Services, they may receive information about what you post or share. For example, when you play a game with your Facebook friends or use the Facebook Comment or Share button on a website, the game developer or website may get information about your activities in the game or receive a comment or link that you share from their website on Facebook. In addition, when you download or use such third-party services, they can access your Public Profile, which includes your username or user ID, your age range and country/language, your list of friends, as well as any information that you share with them. Information collected by these apps, websites or integrated services is subject to their own terms and policies.” – Source
  • “We transfer information to vendors, service providers, and other partners who globally support our business, such as providing technical infrastructure services, analyzing how our Services are used, measuring the effectiveness of ads and services, providing customer service, facilitating payments, or conducting academic research and surveys. These partners must adhere to strict confidentiality obligations in a way that is consistent with this Data Policy and the agreements we enter into with them.” – Source

Gigya.description: “The Leader in Customer Identity Management” – Source
Gigya.prevalence: Moderate: found on 1.0% of surveyed sites (70 instances observed).

Google.description: “Google AdSense is a program run by Google that allows publishers in the Google Network of content sites to serve automatic text, image, video, or interactive media advertisements, that are targeted to site content and audience.” – Source
Google.prevalence: Pandemic: found on 42.0% of surveyed sites (2958 instances observed).

LivePerson.description: “LivePerson is a publicly held American technology company that develops products for online messaging, marketing, and analytics.” – Source
LivePerson.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.3% of surveyed sites (22 instances observed).
LivePerson.notes: • “If you engage with a brand that uses our Services, we may collect:… Web browser and usage information, including IP address, browser types, page view tallies, time spent on each page, page browsing information, operating system and type of device used.”-LivePerson Privacy Policy

LiveRail.description: “LiveRail, a Facebook company, provides advertising technology services to a variety of companies.” – Source
LiveRail.prevalence: Epidemic: found on 5.3% of surveyed sites (370 instances observed).
LiveRail.notes:
• “Our platform is primarily focused on helping publishers and developers monetize their websites and mobile apps. For example, LiveRail offers an ad server, which is a system that stores ads and helps publishers select and deliver those ads to the right people at the right time. We also enable websites and apps to allow advertisers to bid for the chance to show their ads to the kinds of people they want to reach. Our reporting and measurement services help websites, apps, and advertisers understand the effectiveness of the ads shown to people through our platform.”– Source
  • “We use a variety of technologies, such as pixels, browser headers, software development kits (“SDKs”), cookies and other technologies, to collect, use, log and share information…”– Source

NDN.description: “Inform, Inc. operates an online news and information video site that provides personalized content delivery and performance-based monetization to mobile and desktop advertisers and publishers.” – Source
NDN.prevalence: High: found on 1.1% of surveyed sites (76 instances observed).
NDN.notes:
• “INFORM’s websites: www.inform.com, www.newsinc.com and www.politicaliq.com”– Source
  • “We collect information in the aggregate form through the use of cookies and internet protocol (“IP”) addresses, such as demographic information and browsing patterns, including the domain and host from which you access the internet, your domain name, the IP address of the computer you are using, the name of the page that referred you to us, the date and times you enter and exit the Websites, the pages you visit before and after visiting the Websites, the web pages, video content and advertisements you view and links you click on within the Websites, unique identifiers, including mobile device identification numbers that can identify the physical location of such devices in accordance with applicable law, and information collected through web beacons and other technologies.”– Source
  • The following are examples of information we may collect from other sources:
    • demographic data, such as age, gender, and income level,
    • publicly-observed data, such as activities on blogs, videos, and other online postings,
    • your interests and purchase behavior, and
    • other navigation data, such as web sites visited and advertisements viewed or clicked on.

Optimizely.description: “Optimizely is a firm that makes customer-experience optimization software for companies.” – Source
Optimizely.prevalence: Epidemic: found on 5.1% of surveyed sites (358 instances observed).
Optimizely.notes: • ”Cookies And Tracking Technologies: Technologies such as: cookies, beacons, tags and scripts are used by Optimizely and our partners (such as advertising, marketing and analytics), affiliates or analytics or service providers. These technologies may be used in analyzing trends, administering the Sites, tracking users’ movements around the Sites and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole. We may receive reports based on the use of these technologies by such companies on an individual as well as aggregated basis.”– Source

Parse.ly.description: “Parse.ly provides digital publishers with clear audience insights to answer questions about how readers are responding to content.” – Source
Parse.ly.prevalence: High: found on 2.4% of surveyed sites (169 instances observed).
Parse.ly.notes:
• “[W]e may use Cookies (as defined below), web bugs and navigational data like Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) to gather information regarding the date and time of your visit, and your geo-location (from your IP address)” – Source
  • Privacy policy

Pinterest.description: “Pinterest is a web and mobile application startup that operates a software system designed to discover information on the World Wide Web.” – Source
Pinterest.prevalence: High: found on 1.4% of surveyed sites (99 instances observed).

Turn.description: “Turn Inc. provides its business partners—advertisers and their agencies, website and app publishers, other ad inventory providers, and data vendors—with technologies that enable the serving and display of relevant advertisements to individuals who access a publisher’s website, mobile app, or content.” – Source
Turn.prevalence: High: found on 2.9% of surveyed sites (202 instances observed).
Turn.notes: • “Turn also uses web beacons, in combination with cookies, to analyze usage patterns on its website and through Turn advertising technology.”– Source

Visual Revenue.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.2% of surveyed sites (16 instances observed).

CNZZ.description: “Friends of the Union the world’s… global third-party service providers to large data, relying on independent research and development of global data platform, providing customers with one-stop data solutions.” (translated) – Source
CNZZ.prevalence: High: found on 1.8% of surveyed sites (126 instances observed).
CNZZ.notes:
• The domain cnzz.com is owned by the Alibaba group.
  • The domain cnzz.com redirects to umeng.com.
  • “On pages often contain electronic images (called "single-pixel GIF file" or "Web Beacon")” (translation)– Source.

Cardlytics.description: “Every purchase tells a story” – Source
Cardlytics.notes:
• “The power of Cardlytics is driven by its relationships with financial institutions. Cardlytics’ financial institution clients utilize Cardlytics’ services so that they can provide their customers with targeted, relevant offers or advertisements inside – and in some cases, outside – the banking platform. Cardlytics’ financial institution clients include some of the biggest and best names in banking, including Bank of America, PNC, and Regions. Your financial institution might be one of Cardlytics’ clients.”– Source
  • US Privacy Policy
  • UK Privacy Policy

Chartbeat.prevalence: Epidemic: found on 6.0% of surveyed sites (422 instances observed).

Crazy Egg.description: “Crazy Egg allows website owners to create tests to figure out what users are doing on their site.” – Source
Crazy Egg.prevalence: High: found on 2.3% of surveyed sites (159 instances observed).
Crazy Egg.notes:
• “Crazy Egg is like a pair of x-ray glasses that lets you see exactly what people are doing on your website.”– Source
  • “The data Crazy Egg collects may include customized data that varies from client to client but typically includes information about visitors' activities on the client's website, such as how visitors navigate around a web page and the most commonly clicked links on a specific web page.”– Source
  • “Crazy Egg clients use customized and proprietary JavaScript tracking code provided by Crazy Egg to collect and transmit Visitor Information to Crazy Egg's servers. When a user visits a website that uses Crazy Egg's Service, this code contacts Crazy Egg's servers and enables Crazy Egg to collect and analyze the user's activity while visiting our client's website. This information is then stored on Crazy Egg's web servers and databases for use in performing analysis and producing reports for the Crazy Egg client.”– Source

Hotjar.description: “Hotjar is a new all-in-one Analysis and Feedback tool that reveals the online behaviour and feedback of a website’s visitors.” – Source
Hotjar.prevalence: High: found on 3.2% of surveyed sites (222 instances observed).
Hotjar.notes:
• “By combining both A) Analysis and B) Feedback tools, Hotjar gives our clients the 'big picture' of how to improve their site's experience and its performance. The Analysis tools allow you to measure and observe user behaviour (what users do) while the Feedback tools allow you to hear what your users say (Voice of User / Customer).”– Source
  • “We provide our clients with a tracking code, which will be used to collect your information and transmit this to our servers based in Ireland. When you visit a website which makes use of Hotjar, this tracking code will automatically collect the information based on your activity and store it in our servers, for our client's analysis. Information will also be collected from cookies which will be placed on your computer or device by the website.”– Source

Mixpanel.description: “Mixpanel is a business analytics service and company. It tracks user interactions with web and mobile applications and provides tools for targeted communication with them. Its toolset contains in-app A/B tests and user survey forms.” – Source
Mixpanel.prevalence: High: found on 1.2% of surveyed sites (84 instances observed).

New Relic.description: “New Relic’s technology, delivered in a software as a service model, monitors Web and mobile applications in real-time that run in cloud, on-premises, or hybrid environments.” – Source
New Relic.prevalence: Epidemic: found on 9.5% of surveyed sites (668 instances observed).
New Relic.notes:
• New Relic uses web bugs (also known as web beacons) according to their privacy policy.
  • “New Relic collects information under the direction of its Clients, and has no direct relationship with the individuals whose personal data it processes.” – Source

Segment.io.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.6% of surveyed sites (44 instances observed).

AddThis.description: “AddThis is a media web-tracking technology company… The company operates AddThis.com, a social bookmarking service that can be integrated into a website with the use of a web widget.” – Source
AddThis.prevalence: High: found on 3.9% of surveyed sites (275 instances observed).
AddThis.notes:
• AddThis was purchased by Oracle Corporation on January 5, 2016.
  • “AddThis has been acquired by Oracle and will soon transition to the Oracle Privacy Policy.” – Source
  • “When you, an End User use one of our buttons, menus and/or toolboxes that is enabled on one of our Publisher websites (an ‘AddThis Button’), we collect certain non-personally identifiable information automatically for use on our platform (the ‘AddThis Platform’). We enable our Publishers to use this information via the Platform for analytics purposes…” – Source
  • “when you visit a web page that contains one of our AddThis Buttons, our server logs collect your Internet Protocol address, browser type, browser language, the date and time you visited that web page, and (if you came to a web page where an AddThis Button is enabled via a search engine such as Google), the web search that landed you on that web page. We also collect information regarding how often you share content with others using the AddThis platform. We use this information to help us build commercially viable data segments (e.g., travel enthusiast, sports fan) for online ad targeting in order to help make the ads you see on many of the websites you visit more relevant to your interests, and for ad delivery and reporting purposes…” – Source
  • “We also set Cookies and web beacons on web pages where our AddThis Buttons are enabled, and allow our partners to set Cookies and web beacons that are subject to those partners' privacy statements.” – Source
  • “The Oracle Marketing Cloud and Oracle Data Cloud services and our customers, data providers and partners use a variety of technologies to collect Marketing Information, including via ‘cookies’, ‘pixel tags’, HTTP headers (or other communication protocols), and mobile signals and identifiers.” – Source
  • “Oracle creates profiles through the use of cookies, cross-device/cross-context technology (such as statistical IDs), or other unique identifiers provided to us by our customers (such as mobile-advertising IDs)… Oracle analyzes this data to determine if the devices/contexts are likely to be related to a single user. When a probable connection is found, Oracle creates links between the profile IDs and related Interest Data from the different devices/contexts.” – Source

LinkedIn.description: “LinkedIn Network Display, lets advertisers buy ad space from LinkedIn on other sites around the Web. Marketers can target specific groups of people — for example, media sales executives from the Bay Area — show them ads on LinkedIn and then use Internet cookies to continue advertising to them online even after they’ve left LinkedIn.” – Source
LinkedIn.prevalence: High: found on 1.7% of surveyed sites (120 instances observed).
LinkedIn.notes:
• “We target (and measure the performance of) ads to Members, Visitors and others both on and off of our Services through a variety of ad networks and ad exchanges…”– Source
  • “Advertising technologies on and off of our Services, like web beacons, pixels, ad tags, cookies, and mobile identifiers as permitted by mobile platforms;” – Source

Mail.Ru.description: “Mail.Ru's sites reach approximately 86% of Russian Internet users on a monthly basis and the company is in the top 5 of largest Internet companies, based on the number of total pages viewed.” – Source
Mail.Ru.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.9% of surveyed sites (66 instances observed).

ShareThis.description: “The ShareThis consumer engagement and sharing tools are used by three million publishers to drive engagement, traffic and personalization, capturing the widest and deepest sentiments of people across the internet. These sentiments flow into the ShareThis platform as terabytes of data that are processed daily to better understand people” – Source
ShareThis.prevalence: Moderate: found on 0.7% of surveyed sites (52 instances observed).
ShareThis.notes:
• “We collect information when you visit our Web site, use or interact with ShareThis Services (including sharing content with our sharing icons), when you visit our partner publishers Web sites that use our sharing icons or ShareThis Services, and when you view or click advertisements that we serve or are served on our behalf (Usage Information). Usage Information could include general click stream behavior such as Web pages viewed (including the URL addresses of such pages), search queries from which users are directed to a page, navigation from page to page through the ShareThis Services, time spent on each page, and items that you click or select . Usage Information also may include IP address, information about your geographic location derived from your IP address and the domain name of your Internet Service Provider.” – Source
  • “We mostly use cookies and pixel tags to collect this Usage Information.” – Source
  • “Information from Third Parties In addition to the information ShareThis collects directly from users, we also receive certain non-personally identifiable information (e.g., demographic information such as zip code) from our advertisers, ad network and publisher partners, and we may combine this information with what we have collected. We also collect information from third-party Web sites with whom you have registered, like social networks, that those third parties make publicly available.” – Source
  • “While using the ShareThis Services, We may place third party advertisers' and publishers' cookies and pixels on their behalf regarding Usage Information.” – Source
  • “We do not target based on sensitive health-related information, but ShareThis may target general health interest segments such as skincare, diet, fitness, etc.” – Source

VKontakte.description: “[T]he largest European online social media and social networking service.” – Source)
VKontakte.prevalence: High: found on 1.3% of surveyed sites (91 instances observed).

Twitter.description: “Twitter is an online social networking service that enables users to send and read short 140-character messages called ‘tweets’”. – Source
Twitter.prevalence: Pandemic: found on 10.9% of surveyed sites (770 instances observed).
Twitter.notes: • “Tweets can be embedded on other sites as content” – Source
